name: vscode-ruby-test-adapter
description: Run your Ruby tests in the Sidebar of Visual Studio Code
author: Connor Shea <connor.james.shea@gmail.com>

scripts.rebuild: npm run clean && npm run build
scripts.pretest: npm run rebuild && npm run package

rubyTestExplorer.logpanel.description: Write diagnotic logs to an output panel.

rubyTestExplorer.logfile.description: Write diagnostic logs to the given file.

rubyTestExplorer.logLevel.description: Level of information to include in logs

rubyTestExplorer.testFramework.description: Test framework to use by default, for example rspec or minitest.
enumDescriptions: Automatically detect test framework for a given workspace using Bundler.

rubyTestExplorer.rspecCommand.markdownDescription: Define the command to run Rspec tests with, for example `bundle exec rspec`, `spring rspec`, or `rspec`.

rubyTestExplorer.rspecDirectory.markdownDescription: The location of your RSpec directory relative to the root of the workspace.

rubyTestExplorer.minitestCommand.markdownDescription: Define how to run Minitest with Rake, for example `./bin/rake`, `bundle exec rake` or `rake`.

rubyTestExplorer.minitestDirectory.markdownDescription: The location of your test directory relative to the root of the workspace.

rubyTestExplorer.filePattern.markdownDescription: The naming pattern for your tests.

rubyTestExplorer.debuggerHost.markdownDescription: The host to connect the debugger to.

rubyTestExplorer.debuggerPort.markdownDescription: The port to connect the debugger to.

rubyTestExplorer.debugCommand.markdownDescription: Define how to run rdebug-ide, for example `rdebug-ide` or `bundle exec rdebug-ide`.

untrustedWorkspaces.description: This extension runs code from tests and therefore can't be assumed to be safe to use in an untrusted workspace.
